children.subject: EECS will be sponsoring 30 registration scholarships for students in the EECS Department. This is open for majors in CS, EECS, and CS-intended students. I recommend checking with your department for scholarship opportunities.
Hi! Are students in the minor eligible?
Sorry for the delay! Priority will go to students in the majors/intending CS, but students in the minors should definitely apply.

Could Data Science majors apply also? I am majoring in Data Science with a concentration in robotics so I have taken many classes in the EECS department and want to minor in EECS. Would I be eligible? 

Thank you
I emailed and asked - all applicants will be notified by early next week!
Do you know when decisions might be released?
I emailed and asked - recipients will get a code to register. If they already purchased a ticket, they will not be able to reimburse you for it.

Registration for the event opens on July 29. Should we register then, or does getting awarded the scholarship take care of this registration process? I am somewhat hesitant to register without a scholarship as admission is quite pricey, so I would love a clarification on this!

history.content:
Dear Students,

This year the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing will be virtual, and EECS will be sponsoring 30 registration scholarships for students in the EECS Department.  Students may apply for registration scholarships to attend the conference which will be held virtually September 29th - October 2nd, 2020.

Please apply only if you are available to attend.  For information about the conference please visit the following link: https://ghc.anitab.org/
 
The deadline to submit for consideration is July 31st at 5:00pm PST.  Preference will be given to first time attendees and those nearing the end of their academic programs.  

Please apply for the scholarship here.
Questions may be sent to araya@eecs.berkeley.edu.
history.subject: Scholarship Applications for 2020 Virtual Grace Hopper Conference - Due 7/31 at 5:00pm PST
